pages.text: In Experiment 4 you will have to look even harder for the differences in genes on the first two chromosomes. In Experiment 2 it already became clear which gene is responsible for the color of a chicken's head. Now, you will have to find out the genes for several other properties.

You start by taking blood from each chicken and comparing their features with the code of their genes by completing the table. For example, you first look for which gene determines the color of a chicken's body. So, compare black, white and grey chickens (body colour).
TIP:You can analyze two syringes at the same time by placing each in one of the slots at the Laboratory
Secondly, you are also looking for the differences in genes that are responsible for the different blood colors of the chickens in Mendelcraft. Record your findings in the table.
What stands out when you compare these traits and their genes with that of the color of a chicken's head? Do you know why you can have gray chickens and how 3 blood colors can exist?
